en: 58-Document for general distribution (intended for the general public)
Creative Europe provides support for transnational marketing, branding and distribution of European audiovisiual and video-on-demand service.

What is it for?

Creative Europe provides support for transnational marketing, branding and distribution of European audiovisiual and video-on-demand service.

The aim of this is to promote innovative actions and test new distribution modes to improve the circulation of and access to European audiovisual works.

What does it support?

Funding exists for three main types of actions:

1. Support to video-on-demand (VOD) services

2. Support to the development of "On Line Ready" packages

3. Support to innovative, multi-platform releases

These are designed to benefit European professionals of the audiovisual industry, including producers, distributors, sales agents, exhibitors, and rights aggregators, as well as service providers.

Who can take part?

Online distribution opportunities are open to legal entities, such as private companies, non-profit organisations, associations, etc.) established in one of the countries participating in the MEDIA-sub programme.

The organisation should be owned (directly or through majority participation) by nationals from eligible countries.

Individuals may not apply for a grant.

More detailed information on participation is available in the guidelines for specific calls for proposals, as well as from the website of the Education, Audiovisual, and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA), and the Creative Europe Desks.

More detailed information on participation is available in the guidelines for specific calls for proposals, as well as from the website of the Education, Audiovisual, and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA), and the Creative Europe Desks.

How to apply?

More detailed information on the application process is available on the EACEA website.
